author: Alok Deshpande
text:
The Opposition stalled the proceedings in the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly and the Legislative Council on Monday, demanding an apology and a statement from Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on the incident in Pune’s Fergusson College and an alleged ‘purification ceremony’ of Mahad’s historic Chavdar Lake.

Leader of the Opposition Radhakrishna Vikhe-Patil raised the issue of student clashes and the suicide of a farmer outside the Mantralaya through an adjournment motion.

“The farmer’s death is a clear indication that this government has failed to take measures to resolve agrarian issues. The government should not only make a statement but also apologise for what has happened in Pune and Mahad. Is the government trying to create an atmosphere of communal animosity in the State,” Mr. Vikhe-Patil asked.

As Congress and NCP MLAs gathered in front of the Speaker’s Chair, both Houses were adjourned for the day.

In the Legislative Council, Leader of the Opposition Dhananjay Munde criticised the government for attempting to file sedition cases against students for raising Jai Bhim slogans. “If this is the case, then I will shout Jai Bhim a hundred times,” he said.

On the ‘purification’ of Chavdar Lake, Shiv Sena MLA Bharat Gogawale said the ceremony was part of the government’s ‘Jal Abhiyaan.’ “I was invited as I am the local MLA. Certain anti-social elements are using it to widen rifts in society.” The lake is important in the history of the Dalit rights movement as Dr. B.R. Ambedkar had led an agitation against the ban by upper castes on Dalits drinking water from it.”
title: Furore in Maharashtra Assembly over Fergusson College issue
